description:
Another great valley to explore off the Crowdis Mountain Road.  After exploring a for  while I have visited many of the valleys that are on the east side of the Crowdis Mtn Rd and drain to the Baddeck river system…..Spoiler alert; they never fail to contain some amazing waterfalls for those who dare to go places without trails!

This valley is accessible via Warehouse Rd which is a cross between an ATV path and a logging road.  Drives as far as you can until your GPS point towards the valley.  Pick carefully as the forest has been logged in places so pick a spot where you still have a mature forest.  Hike about 600m to the lip of the valley and then prepare to go downhill for a while.

I ended right at a fall that although only has drops of 10 and 15 ft has carved an impressive drop through solid rock.   I then took a gamble and went upstream a few hundred meres and was rewarded by a gorgeous 25 to 30 ft drop.
directions: Cabot Trail.  Turn on Crowdis Mtn Rd and drive 5.7 km to the Warehouse Rd.  Drive to approximately; 46.15781014465851, -60.823584854575685 and park.
title: Adelaide Brook Falls
